required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Ixekizumab (LY2439821) in Participants in Japan With Generalized Pustular Psoriasis and Erythrodermic Psoriasis
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Open-Label, Post Marketing Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Efficacy And Safety Of Ixekizumab in Patients With Generalized Pustular Psoriasis and Erythrodermic Psoriasis

brief_summary.textblock: The reason for this study is to see if the study drug ixekizumab is safe and effective in participants with generalized pustular psoriasis and erythrodermic psoriasis.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants who Improved Global Improvement Score (GIS) at Least 1 Point from Week 12 and with ≤2 of GIS
primary_outcome.description: Number of Participants who Improved Global Improvement Score (GIS) at Least 1 Point from Week 12 and with ≤2 of GIS

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with GIS grade 1: Resolved
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Participants with GIS grade 1: Resolved

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with GIS grade 2: Improved
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Participants with GIS grade 2: Improved

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with GIS grade 3: Unchanged
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Participants with GIS grade 3: Unchanged

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with GIS grade 4: Worsened
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Participants with GIS grade 4: Worsened

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants who Achieved static Physician Global Assessment (sPGA) (0, 1)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Participants who Achieved sPGA (0, 1)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants who Achieved at Least a 75% Improvement from Baseline in Psoriasis Area and Severity Index (PASI) Score (PASI 75)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Participants who Achieved at Least a 75% Improvement from Baseline in Psoriasis Area and Severity Index (PASI) Score (PASI 75)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Psoriasis Scalp Severity Index (PSSI) in Participants with Scalp Involvement at Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in PSSI in Participants with Scalp Involvement at Baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Percent of Body Surface Area (BSA) Involvement of Psoriasis
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in Percent of BSA Involvement of Psoriasis

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Dermatology Life Quality Index (DLQI) Total Score
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in DLQI Total Score

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants who Developed Treatment-Emergent Anti-Ixekizumab Antibodies (TE-ADA)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Participants who Developed TE-ADA

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants who Developed Neutralizing Anti-Ixekizumab Antibody (NAb)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Participants who Developed NAb

secondary_outcome.measure: Generalized Pustular Psoriasis (GPP) Only: Change from Baseline on Generalized Pustular Psoriasis Severity Index
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline on Generalized Pustular Psoriasis Severity Index

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Present with GPP or EP based on an investigator-confirmed diagnosis and meet the associated criteria
- GPP: Meet the criteria for GPP set by Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare (MHLW) at screening and baseline regardless of IL-36 mutation status.
- EP: Diagnosed to have BSA ≥80% involvement (with inflammatory erythema) at screening and baseline.
- Candidates for phototherapy and/or systemic therapy
- Men must agree to use a reliable method of birth control during the study
- Women must agree to use birth control or remain abstinent during the study and for at least 12 weeks after stopping treatment
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of drug-induced psoriasis
- Concurrent or recent use of any biologic agent
- Cannot avoid excessive sun exposure or use of tanning booths for at least 4 weeks prior to enrollment and during the study
- Have previously received ixekizumab
- Serious disorder or illness other than psoriasis
- Serious infection within the last 12 weeks
- Breastfeeding or nursing (lactating) women

overall_official.last_name: Call 1-877-CTLILLY (1-877-285-4559) or 1-317-615-4559 Mon - Fri 9 AM - 5 PM Eastern time (UTC/GMT - 5 hours, EST)

facility.name: Osaka City University Medical School Hospital

patient_data.ipd_description: Anonymized individual patient level data will be provided in a secure access environment upon approval of a research proposal and a signed data sharing agreement.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data are available 6 months after the primary publication and approval of the indication studied in the US and EU, whichever is later. Data will be indefinitely available for requesting.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: A research proposal must be approved by an independent review panel and researchers must sign a data sharing agreement.
